hero.question: When AI does everything for you, who proves you still exist?
hero.subtitle: Local Sovereignty Compute Kernel

philosophy.title: // Right to History
philosophy.definition: The Right to History means: an actor spends their own energy to initiate an action, writes the outcome into verifiable world state, and leaves an indelible trace. This right is inalienable, non-delegable, and irrevocable.
philosophy.p_desc: Human or Agent. Humans exist unconditionally; agents exist conditionally.
philosophy.e_desc: Universal cost metric for actions. Anchored to hardware INT8 TOPS, not arbitrary tokens.
philosophy.s_desc: All persistent reality and verifiable history. S' = f(S, A, E).
philosophy.formula: The system advances by action, not by time.
philosophy.committer: The system must have a single committer — a structural role, not a moral authority.

steps.validate_desc: Check actor status, boundary permissions, action format
steps.quote_desc: Compute energy cost of the action
steps.settle_desc: Finalize energy accounting incl. I/O overhead
steps.append_desc: Write to append-only log + cryptographic hash

invariants.title: Single Committer
invariants.desc: One commit authority per history domain

invariants.title: Total Order Log
invariants.desc: Committed events form a single total-order sequence

invariants.title: State Reconstructability
invariants.desc: Current state derivable by replaying events

invariants.title: Semantic Append-Only
invariants.desc: Committed events cannot be rewritten, only compensated

invariants.title: Governance Auditable
invariants.desc: Governance rules and changes enter event history

invariants.title: Evidence Independently Verifiable
invariants.desc: Third parties can verify history integrity

showcase_entry.title: ENTER THE LAB
showcase_entry.subtitle: See what's being built with PunkGo Kernel

showcase.title: // Built with PunkGo
showcase.subtitle: Projects forged on the kernel. Each one writes its own history.

watchdog.name: WATCHDOG
watchdog.desc: Creation process provenance. Watches your files, submits every change to the kernel's append-only log with Merkle proofs. Not just proving a file exists — proving when and how it came into being.
